CIRCULAR  16 / 2002 
 
 
Sub: CARRIAGE OF TRAINING MODELS AND EXPLOSIVES BY AIR BY 
CONTROLLER OF EXPLOSIVES AND BY DY. COMMISSIONER OF 
SECURITY (BDDS). 
 
 
 
The Controllers of Explosives and Dy. Commissioner of Security (BDDS) 
of this Bureau are authorized to carry IED models and small quantities of 
explosives such as RDX, PETN, PEK, TNT etc for the purpose of imparting 
training in “Recognitions of Explosive Devices and Bomb Threat Procedure” at 
airports by aircraft. These officers shall take adequate safety precaution while 
packing and transporting the explosives. Models and Explosives shall  be carried 
as registered baggage only. No detonator shall be carried by above officers in an 
aircraft. 
 
The permit No. 90-DG/2002 dated 29.4.2002 issued DGCA on this subject 
is enclosed for strict compliance by all concerned. 
 
(R.K. Singh) 
Addl. Commissioner of  Security (CA) 
 
Ref .NO.CAS-11(2)2000-DIV-II dated 23.5.2002

PERIMIT NO. 90 – DG / 2002                             No. 8/21/02-IR 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dated .29-4-2002 
 
 
In exercise of the powers conferred by rule 8 (2) ( c) OF THE aircraft 
Rules, 1937, delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Tourism and 
Civil Aviation notification No. S.O.727 (E) dated 4th October 1994, the Director of 
Regulations & Information in the civil Aviation Department authorizes the 
CONTROLLER OF EXPLOSIVES AND  THE DY. COMMISSIONER (BDDS) OF 
THE BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY, NEW DELHI  to carry RDX, 
PETN, Tetryle, TNT, safety fuze, cordtex etc. (quantity not exceeding 10 gms)  
by air as per the Instructions for the Safe Transport of Dangerous goods by Air 
(ICAO Doc. 9284-AN/905) at any airport within the territory of India subject to 
following conditions: -
2:
(i) 
The goods are so packed, protected and secured as to avoid the 
possibility of their being a source of danger; 
 
(ii) 
The goods are carried in checked baggage only so as not to be 
accessible to the passengers on board aircraft; and 
 
(iii) 
The nature of the goods is plainly and conspicuously marked on the 
outside of the package (s). 
 
 
Unless suspended or revoked earlier, this permit shall remain valid w.e.f. 
29.04.2002 to 30.04.2003. 
 
(R.K. MAHESHWARI) 
DIRECTOR OF REGULATIONS & INFORMATION
